title: Static friction - two boxes at rest

content.question: A hanging block of mass <math alttext="1.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> is attached by a string to a block of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> that rests on a rough, horizontal surface, as shown in the figure. The mass of the string and pulley are negligible, and the pulley can rotate with negligible friction around its axle. What is the minimum coefficient of static friction <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Î¼</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math> between the surface and the <math alttext="2.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block that would allow both blocks to remain at rest when released?
